comments:
Eclipse M5

1) Import JUnit 3.8.1 (as per Smoke test)
2) In the package explorer, select junit.runner.BaseTestRunner
3) From the context menu, select Refactor->Extract Interface
4) Input a name for the interface, select all methods
5) press the preview button
6) observe: you get an exception:

Markus, can you please investigate. This is either us or core, but I suspect 
that we pass in invalid arguments.

The scenario with BaseTestRunner is fixed. However, there are more problems with
comments following an (abstract) method declaration.

Should use ASTRewrite to extract the method declarations to avoid fiddling
around with comments.

Closing this one, since the original bug has been fixed. Problems with comments
following the method declaration are the subject of bug 51375.
Verified by Danny Dig. Works fine now.
